name: codex-editor-extension
description: Support for `.codex` notebooks and translation source files. Includes Translator's Copilot Language Server for translation drafting and checking diagnostics and features.

viewsWelcome.contents: Welcome to the Codex Translation Editor! When you bookmark cells in your Codex notebook, you will see navigation shortcuts here.

walkthroughs.title: Set up Local/Offline Translator's Copilot
walkthroughs.description: A simple walkthrough to help you set up a large language model on your device to benefit from the Copilot feature.

steps.title: Download LM Studio
steps.description:
Download LM Studio to get a local LLM running to power your Translator's Copilot.

[Download LM Studio](https://lmstudio.ai)

steps.title: Download Model
steps.description: Download the model you want to use for your Copilot. Not sure which one to try? Try searching LM Studio for `TheBloke/neural-chat-7B-v3-1-GGUF` (note the specific file you want is the `neural-chat-7b-v3-1.Q4_K_S.gguf` variant).

steps.title: Initialize Downloaded Model
steps.description: Load the model you want to use for your Copilot. Click on the model dropdown at the top-center of the LM Studio screen, then select the model you downloaded (e.g., `neural-chat-7b-v3-1.Q4_K_S.gguf`).

steps.title: Start AI Model
steps.description: Make the AI model you downloaded accessible by the Translator's Copilot by clicking on the green play 'Start Server' button in LM Studio.

steps.title: Set Main Chat Language
steps.description:
Set your main chat language (also accessible in the Translator's Copilot settings).

[Set Chat Language](command:translators-copilot.setMainChatLanguage)

steps.title: Try Chatting with the Translator's Copilot
steps.description: Try chatting with the Translator's Copilot by clicking on the chat button in the sidebar, then clicking on the 'Chat' button in the top-right of the chat window.

steps.title: Try Inline Completions
steps.description: Try inline completions with the Translator's Copilot by clicking on the chat button in the sidebar, then clicking on the 'Chat' button in the top-right of the chat window.

walkthroughs.title: Start a Codex Project
walkthroughs.description: A simple walkthrough to help you start a new Codex translation project.

steps.title: Open Project Folder
steps.description:
First, let's open a folder where your new Codex project will be initialized.
[Open Project Folder](command:workbench.action.files.openFolder)

steps.title: Name Project
steps.description:
Now that we have a folder, let's name your new Codex project.
[Name Project](command:codex-project-manager.nameProject)

steps.title: Select Source Language
steps.description:
Now that we have a folder, let's initialize your new Codex project.
[Select Source Language](command:codex-project-manager.changeSourceLanguage)

steps.title: Select Target Language
steps.description:
Now that we have a folder, let's initialize your new Codex project.
[Select target Language](command:codex-project-manager.changeTargetLanguage)

steps.title: Set Project Abbreviation
steps.description:
Let's set an abbreviation for your Codex project.
[Set Abbreviation](command:codex-project-manager.editAbbreviation)

steps.title: Select Project Category
steps.description:
Now, let's choose a category for your Codex project.
[Select Category](command:codex-project-manager.selectCategory)

steps.title: Add Source Text
steps.description:
Now that we have a folder, let's add a source Text to your Codex project.
[Download Source Text](command:codex-project-manager.downloadSourceText)
 or 
 [Import Local USFM Text](command:codex-project-manager.importLocalUsfmSourceText)

steps.title: Create files
steps.description:
Now that we have a folder, let's initialize your new Codex project.
[Create New Project](command:codex-project-manager.initializeNewProject)
 or 
 [Import USFM Project](command:codex-project-manager.initializeImportProject)

steps.title: Start Translating
steps.description:
Now that we've initialized all these files, let's start translating your new Codex project.
[Start Translating](command:codex-project-manager.startTranslating)

codex-project-manager.userEmail.description: Email of the user e.g. user@example.com

codex-project-manager.primarySourceText.description: Path to the primary source text for the project

codex-project-manager.knownProjects.description: List of known Codex project paths

codex-project-manager.watchedFolders.description: List of folders to watch for Codex projects

codex-editor-extension.scm.remoteUrl.description: The remote URL to cloud sync to.

translators-copilot-server.enable.description: Enable or disable the Translators Copilot feature.

translators-copilot-server.primarySource.description: The source text to use for the Translators Copilot feature.

translators-copilot.api_key.title: API Key
translators-copilot.api_key.description: Your own OpenAI API key. Ignorable for local LLM. NOTE: Do not set this in workspace settings. This may compromise your key if .vscode/settings.json is saved to the cloud.

translators-copilot.max_tokens.title: Max Tokens
translators-copilot.max_tokens.description: The maximum number of output tokens for the completion API.

translators-copilot.temperature.title: Temperature
translators-copilot.temperature.description: The randomness level of output generation. A higher value leads to more random outputs.

translators-copilot.main_chat_language.title: Main Chat Language
enum: မြန်မာဘာသာ (Burmese)
translators-copilot.main_chat_language.description: The main language used for the chat interface.

translators-copilot.chatSystemMessage.title: Rules for AI (System Message)
translators-copilot.chatSystemMessage.default: This is a chat between a helpful Bible translation assistant and a Bible translator. The assistant will provide helpful answers and suggestions to the translator, often relying on the translator's current project and reference resources. The translator will ask questions and provide context to the assistant. The translator's aim is to be consistent and faithful in a fairly literalistic rendering of the source text.
translators-copilot.chatSystemMessage.description: The system message controlling the behavior of the chat system and inline completion. You can customize this message to fit your needs, or ask the copilot to translate it for you into your preferred interface language.

translators-copilot.sourceTextSelectionM.description: The method of selecting the source text. If set to manual, use 'ctrl + s, ctrl + b' to change the source text.

translators-copilot.numberOfFewShotExamp.description: The number of sample translation pairs to show the Copilot.

translators-copilot.contextSize.description: The size of the context to be used for completion. Small is 5 cells, medium is 10 cells, large is 50 cells.

translators-copilot.additionalResourcesD.description: The directory path containing additional resources for completion context. Will read all files in directory and put them in the context. No resources if path is invalid.

translators-copilot.llmEndpoint.description: The endpoint for the completion API. Currently only supports OpenAI API, or openai-compatible local endpoints such as LM Studio, etc.

translators-copilot.wsEndpoint.description: The endpoint for the realtime chat API. Currently only supports OpenAI API.

translators-copilot.model.title: LLM Model
translators-copilot.model.description: Model name selected for inference. Ignorable for local LLM. If you are using a custom LLM, set to 'custom' and update the customModel setting below.

translators-copilot.customModel.title: Custom LLM Model
translators-copilot.customModel.description: Custom LLM model to use for inference. Ignorable for OpenAI API.

translators-copilot.sourceBookWhitelist.title: Source Book Whitelist
translators-copilot.sourceBookWhitelist.description: Limits context building to specified books. Leave empty to include all. We recommend to leave empty for best results.

translators-copilot.debugMode.title: Debugging Mode
translators-copilot.debugMode.description: If activated, inline completion LLM prompts will be saved to the `copilot-messages.log` file in the project.

translators-copilot.wordFrequencyThresho.title: Word Frequency Threshold
translators-copilot.wordFrequencyThresho.description: The minimum frequency of a word to be automatically added to the dictionary. Changing this value will trigger updates to the dictionary.

translators-copilot.enableChatReflection.title: Enable Chat Reflection
translators-copilot.enableChatReflection.description: After giving an initial response in the chat, the Copilot will reflect on the response and replace it with a new one after a bit.

translators-copilot.chatReflectionConcer.title: Chat Reflection Concern
translators-copilot.chatReflectionConcer.description: This is an optional field to specify what the reflection should focus on in the chat response.  Use this to set a specific topic to focus on or perspective to keep in mind.

translators-copilot.textDirection.description: Text direction for the editor (left-to-right or right-to-left)

scripts.vscode:prepublish: npm run build:webviews && npm run compile
scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
